title: Zenklas X - 2 Albums - Discography 2003-2006

Ãƒâ€¦Ã‚Â½enklas X ("Sign X")

Ãƒâ€¦Ã‚Â½enklas X might be the only Lithuanian example of improfolk, a genre coined by the group themselves. Eschewing traditional song structures in favour of free-flowing, at times almost raga-like meditative improvisation, infused with just the right amount of subtle psychedelia, Ãƒâ€¦Ã‚Â½enklas X have invented a type of folk music that doesnÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t belong to any single ethnic tradition. It does have a fair number of references to archaic Lithuanian folk, but on the deeper level it is a universal language understood intuitively. Furthermore, the music of Ãƒâ€¦Ã‚Â½enklas X does not belong to the past ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ it is rather the connection between the primeval times and the endless tomorrow itself, a traditional pattern woven with modern thread.

Jurij Dobriakov

Ãƒâ€¦Ã‚Â½enklas X - Take (mp3; CBR; 256 kb/s)
:::
The enchanting acoustic improvisation of ethno sound and contemporary music - a new experimental delight from the legendary Lithuanian artists' group, reborned after 15 years! Played with variety of natural acoustic instruments, these 8 songs intake one to the mantric world of cozy mysterious sound, adding to archaic origins the oriental element, ambient, free-jazz, world, subtle electronic and avantgarde. Really calm and pleasant album, bringing folklore spirit, though never quoting it. Composed to listen and to find a personal bond with the language of sounds this record is to experience diversity and enjoy acoustic festivity. CD comes in a deluxe digipack, limited 1000 pcs. 

Record company: Dangus
